commit_message:
Configure placement section in neutron conf

Without it segment plugin fails to connect with
placement api. Configure the placement section
if service is deployed.

Closes-Bug: #1973783
Change-Id: Ie7f37770a04f622735cf2263c601257669ab5064
(cherry picked from commit 92a34dbe951f2ab31fb3432e61cf34db034b0145)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/47/842747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configuration for placement client configure_keystone_authtoken_middleware $NEUTRON_CONF placement placement

commit_message:
Add the corresponding DB context to all SQL transactions

Neutron code migrated to SQLAlchemy 2.0[1], the goal of this
patch is to make the fwaas plugin code compliant with
SQLAlchemy 2.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833247

Related-Bug: #1964575

Change-Id: If3e996740d4b5024e9c798227d0a58ceb09eb1d6

commit_message:
Fix installation of glusterfs repo on rocky linux

On Rocky the distribution version is 8.5 / 8.6 and will change as
releases are made. We only need to know that it is Rocky 8.

Change-Id: I7dc2ca2b66ac254d5ef13c8e1790eb2b24df1be3

commit_message:
Fix a type error in the MTU evaluation

To avoid the following error since required_mtu is int:
TypeError: argument of type 'int' is not iterable

Closes-Bug: #1973838
Change-Id: I36796018a537e6030bf46f283f1c74ef1fe4772c

commit_message:
Update Python as per the Zed cycle testing runtime

In the Zed cycle, support and testing for Python versions 3.6 and 3.7
was dropped. [1]

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia000640a3a6bc33700b27ecf2173954e11237d6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/22/842722/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | Support for Python versions 3.6 and 3.7 was dropped. The minimum supported version is now Python 3.8.

commit_message:
Make centos-8 jobs non voting before OSA makes yoga branch

Zed version of openstack drops support for python3.6, so OSA
functional jobs are faiking as they pull in master code and
upper-constraints. Disable centos-8-stream jobs until a proper
fix is found.

Simplify retrieval of upper-constraints to allow it to be taken
from an arbitrary branch.

Change-Id: I1778f90db06607712586295b98c702123ae15a4d

commit_message:
Add HoneycombData HStor v1.0.0 cinder volume driver

Change-Id: I5cca1cf39314daccb7ff3417674fe9aeb5fd685d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/37/710137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # Copyright 2019 HoneycombData Inc # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Volume driver for HoneycombData HStor Storage Array. """ import functools import random import re import string import requests import six from oslo_concurrency.processutils import eventlet from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import units from cinder import exception from cinder.i18n import _ from cinder.objects.snapshot import Snapshot from cinder.volume import configuration from cinder.volume.drivers.san import san DRIVER_VERSION = "1.0.0" REST_API_VERSION = 1 DEFAULT_SLEEP = 5 LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) hcd_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('hcd_svip', help='Overrides default cluster SVIP with the one specified.'), cfg.StrOpt('hcd_client_id', help='HoneycombData HStor client ID for auth'), cfg.StrOpt('hcd_client_secret', help='HoneycombData HStor client secret for auth'), cfg.IntOpt('hcd_min_cluster_size', default=3, help='HoneycombData HStor minimum cluster size'), cfg.IntOpt('hcd_replication_factor', default=3, help='HoneycombData HStor replication factor') ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(hcd_opts, group=configuration.SHARED_CONF_GROUP) class HoneycombDataAPIException(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException): message = _("Bad response from HoneycombData API") class HoneycombDataDriverException(exception.VolumeDriverException): message = _("HoneycombData Cinder Driver exception") class HoneycombDataDuplicateVolumeNameException(exception.Duplicate): message = _("Detected more than one volume with name %(vol_name)s") class HoneycombDataRetryableException(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException): message = _("Retryable HoneycombData Exception encountered") class HoneycombDataVolumeBusyException(exception.VolumeIsBusy): message = _("HoneycombData Cinder Driver: Volume Busy") class HoneycombDataBaseVolumeDriver(san.SanISCSIDriver): """OpenStack driver to enable HoneycombData HStor controller.""" VERSION = DRIVER_VERSION # ThirdPartySystems wiki page CI_WIKI_NAME = "HoneycombData_HStor_CI" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(HoneycombDataBaseVolumeDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.hcd_client = None self._storage_protocol = None self.verify = False self.configuration.append_config_values(hcd_opts) @staticmethod def get_driver_options(): return hcd_opts def _check_config(self): """Ensure that the cinder config file has the required fields.""" required_config = ['san_ip', 'san_login', 'san_password', 'hcd_client_id', 'hcd_client_secret', 'hcd_svip'] for attr in required_config: if not getattr(self.configuration, attr, None): raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=_('{} is not set.'.format(attr))) def do_setup(self, context): """Setup the HoneycombData HStor REST API client.""" self._check_config() # Setup hcd API client try: self.hcd_client = HoneycombDataRestClient( mvip=self.configuration.san_ip, username=self.configuration.san_login, password=self.configuration.san_password, client_id=self.configuration.hcd_client_id, client_secret=self.configuration.hcd_client_secret, svip=self.configuration.hcd_svip, min_cluster_size=self.configuration.hcd_min_cluster_size, replication_factor=self.configuration.hcd_replication_factor, verify=self.verify) except Exception: LOG.error('Failed to create REST client. Check san ip, username, password ' 'and make sure the HStor version is compatible') raise @staticmethod def _generate_random_string(length): """Generates a random string of given length.""" char_set = string.ascii_lowercase return ''.join(random.sample(char_set, length)) def _get_model_info(self, volume_name): """Get model info for the volume""" return ( {'provider_location': self._get_provider_location(volume_name), 'provider_auth': None}) def _get_provider_location(self, volume_name): """Get volume iqn for initiator access.""" volume_id = self.hcd_client.get_volume_id_by_name(volume_name) volume_info = self.hcd_client.get_volume_info(volume_id) iqn = volume_info['iscsiTarget']['iqn'] iscsi_portal = self.hcd_client.svip + ':3260' provider_location = '{} {}'.format(iscsi_portal, iqn) return provider_location def get_volume_stats(self, refresh=False): """Get volume stats. More like cluster stats.""" if refresh: try: self.update_cluster_stats() except HoneycombDataAPIException: pass LOG.debug('HoneycombData cluster_stats: {}'.format(self._stats)) return self._stats def update_cluster_stats(self): """Retrieve stats info for the Cluster.""" data = {} backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name') data["volume_backend_name"] = backend_name or self.__class__.__name__ data["vendor_name"] = 'HoneycombData Inc' data["driver_version"] = self.VERSION data["storage_protocol"] = 'iSCSI' try: self.hcd_client.get_access_token() cluster_info = self.hcd_client.get_cluster_info(self.hcd_client.cluster_id) except HoneycombDataAPIException: data['total_capacity_gb'] = 0 data['free_capacity_gb'] = 0 self._stats = data LOG.error('Could not get cluster info to update_cluster_stats') return free_capacity = (cluster_info['usableSpace'] - cluster_info['usedSpace']) data['total_capacity_gb'] = (cluster_info['usableSpace'] / units.Gi) data['free_capacity_gb'] = float(free_capacity / units.Gi) self._stats = data def create_volume(self, volume): """Create a new volume.""" self.hcd_client.hcd_create_volume(volume) eventlet.sleep(DEFAULT_SLEEP) return self._get_model_info(volume['display_name']) def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): """Extend an existing volume.""" self.hcd_client.hcd_extend_volume(volume, new_size) def delete_volume(self, volume): """Delete a given volume.""" self.hcd_client.hcd_delete_volume(volume) def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): """Create a snapshot.""" self.hcd_client.hcd_create_snapshot(snapshot) def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): """Delete a given snapshot.""" self.hcd_client.hcd_delete_snapshot(snapshot) def _clone_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): """Clone volume from snapshot. Extend the volume if the size of the volume is more than the snapshot. """ self.hcd_client.hcd_clone_volume(volume, snapshot) clone_volume_size = volume['size'] if clone_volume_size > snapshot['volume_size']: self.hcd_client.hcd_extend_volume(volume, clone_volume_size) def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): """Create a clone of the specified volume. Since hcd does not support cloning from a volume directly without a snapshot, we first take a snapshot for the volume to be cloned from openstack and then clone the volume for this snapshot.""" if volume['display_name'] != src_vref['display_name']: raise HoneycombDataDuplicateVolumeNameException("Detected more than one volume " "with name {}".format(src_vref['display_name'])) snapshot_name = ('openstack-clone-{}-{}'.format(volume['display_name'], self._generate_random_string(5))) snapshot = Snapshot() snapshot.display_name = snapshot_name snapshot.volume = src_vref snapshot.volume_size = src_vref['size'] self.hcd_client.hcd_create_snapshot(snapshot) self._clone_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): """Create a volume from a given snapshot.""" self._clone_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): """Driver entry point to attach a volume to an instance.""" hcd_initiator = self.hcd_client.use_hcd_cinder_initiator(connector) # Add volume and initiator to hcd volume access group self.hcd_client.add_volume_to_vag(volume) self.hcd_client.add_initiator_to_vag(hcd_initiator) properties = super(HoneycombDataBaseVolumeDriver, self).initialize_connection(volume, connector) properties['data']['target_lun'] = 1 properties['data']['discard'] = True return properties def terminate_connection(self, volume, connector, **kwargs): """Driver entry point to detach a volume from an instance.""" hcd_initiator = self.hcd_client.use_hcd_cinder_initiator(connector) # Remove volume and initiator from hcd volume access group self.hcd_client.remove_volume_from_vag(volume) self.hcd_client.remove_initiator_from_vag(hcd_initiator) eventlet.sleep(DEFAULT_SLEEP) def create_export(self, context, volume, connector): """Driver entry point to get the export info for a new volume.""" return self._get_model_info(volume['display_name']) def _connection_checker(func): """Decorator to re-establish and re-run the api if session has expired.""" @functools.wraps(func) def recursive_connection_checker(self, *args, **kwargs): for attempts in range(2): try: return func(self, *args, **kwargs) except Exception as e: if attempts < 1 and (re.search("Failed to execute", six.text_type(e))): LOG.info('Session might have expired, Trying to relogin...') self.get_access_token() continue else: LOG.error('Re-throwing Exception {}'.format(e)) raise return recursive_connection_checker class HoneycombDataRestClient(object): """Invokes HoneycombData's HStor REST API calls.""" def __init__(self, api_version=REST_API_VERSION, *args, **kwargs): self.access_token = None self.headers = None self.active_cluster = None self.cluster_id = None self.volume_access_group_id = None self.mvip = kwargs['mvip'] self.username = kwargs['username'] self.password = kwargs['password'] self.client_id = kwargs['client_id'] self.client_secret = kwargs['client_secret'] self.min_cluster_size = kwargs['min_cluster_size'] self.replication_factor = kwargs['replication_factor'] self.svip = kwargs['svip'] self.verify = kwargs['verify'] self.api_version = 'v{}'.format(api_version) self.mgmt_server_port = 8443 self.base_endpoint = 'https://{}:{}'.format(self.mvip, self.mgmt_server_port) self.access_token_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/oauth/token' self.clusters_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/clusters'.format(self.api_version) self.hosts_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/hosts'.format(self.api_version) self.volume_access_groups_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/volume-access-groups'.format(self.api_version) self.initiators_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/initiators'.format(self.api_version) self.volumes_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/volumes'.format(self.api_version) self.snapshots_endpoint = self.base_endpoint + '/{}/snapshots'.format(self.api_version) self.get_access_token() # Create/Reuse hcd cinder cluster self.use_hcd_cinder_cluster() LOG.debug('HCD cluster id: {}'.format(self.cluster_id)) # Create/Reuse hcd cinder Volume Access Group which will be used later for initiator access self.use_hcd_cinder_vag() LOG.debug('HCD volume access group id: {}'.format(self.volume_access_group_id)) def get_access_token(self): response = requests.post(self.access_token_endpoint, verify=self.verify, auth=(self.client_id, self.client_secret), data={'grant_type': 'password', 'username': self.username, 'password': self.password} ) if response.status_code != 200: msg = _('Failed to login for user {}'.format(self.username)) raise HoneycombDataAPIException(msg) self.access_token = response.json()['access_token'] self.headers = {'authorization': 'Bearer {}'.format(self.access_token)} def use_hcd_cinder_cluster(self): all_clusters = self.get_cluster_info() if all_clusters: for cluster in all_clusters: if cluster.get('clusterName') == 'cinder-cluster': self.active_cluster = cluster self.cluster_id = self.active_cluster.get('clusterId') return self.create_cluster() else: self.create_cluster() def create_cluster(self): data = { "cluster": { "clusterName": 'cinder-cluster', "minClusterSize": self.min_cluster_size, "replicationFactor": self.replication_factor, "virtualIp": self.svip, "type": 0 } } self.active_cluster = self.post(endpoint=self.clusters_endpoint, data=data) self.cluster_id = self.active_cluster.get('clusterId') self.add_hosts_to_cluster() eventlet.sleep(60) return self.active_cluster def get_cluster_info(self, cluster_id=None): if not cluster_id: response = self.get(endpoint=self.clusters_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] else: get_cluster_by_id_endpoint = self.clusters_endpoint + '/{}'.format(cluster_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_cluster_by_id_endpoint) return response.json() def get_free_hosts(self): free_hosts_endpoint = self.hosts_endpoint + '?onlyFreeHost=true' response = self.get(free_hosts_endpoint) json_response_dict = response.json() return json_response_dict.values()[0] def add_hosts_to_cluster(self): join_cluster_endpoint = self.hosts_endpoint + '/join' free_hosts_list = self.get_free_hosts() if len(free_hosts_list) == 0: raise HoneycombDataDriverException('No host available for the cluster!') for i in free_hosts_list: host_id = i.get('hostId') data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "hosts": [host_id] } self.put(endpoint=join_cluster_endpoint, data=data) def use_hcd_cinder_vag(self): all_volume_access_groups = self.get_volume_access_group_info() if all_volume_access_groups: for vag in all_volume_access_groups: if vag.get('volumeAccessGroupName') == 'cinder-vag': self.volume_access_group_id = vag.get('volumeAccessGroupId') return self.create_volume_access_group() else: self.create_volume_access_group() def create_volume_access_group(self): data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "volumeAccessGroupName": 'cinder-vag', "initiators": [], "volumes": [] } json_response = self.post(endpoint=self.volume_access_groups_endpoint, data=data) self.volume_access_group_id = json_response.get('volumeAccessGroupId') return json_response def get_volume_access_group_info(self): get_all_volume_access_groups_on_cluster_endpoint = self.volume_access_groups_endpoint + '/{}'\ .format(self.cluster_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_all_volume_access_groups_on_cluster_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] def add_volume_to_vag(self, volume): volume_id = self.get_volume_id_by_name(volume.get('display_name', '')) add_volume_to_volume_access_group_endpoint = self.volume_access_groups_endpoint + '/{}/{}/add-volumes' \ .format(self.cluster_id, self.volume_access_group_id) self.post(endpoint=add_volume_to_volume_access_group_endpoint, data=[volume_id], json_return=False) def remove_volume_from_vag(self, volume): volume_id = self.get_volume_id_by_name(volume.get('display_name', '')) remove_volume_from_volume_access_group_endpoint = self.volume_access_groups_endpoint + '/{}/{}/remove-volumes' \ .format(self.cluster_id, self.volume_access_group_id) self.post(endpoint=remove_volume_from_volume_access_group_endpoint, data=[volume_id], json_return=False) def add_initiator_to_vag(self, initiator): add_initiator_to_volume_access_group_endpoint = self.volume_access_groups_endpoint + '/{}/{}/add-initiators' \ .format(self.cluster_id, self.volume_access_group_id) self.post(endpoint=add_initiator_to_volume_access_group_endpoint, data=[initiator.get('initiatorId')], json_return=False) def remove_initiator_from_vag(self, initiator): remove_initiator_from_vag_endpoint = self.volume_access_groups_endpoint + '/{}/{}/remove-initiators' \ .format(self.cluster_id, self.volume_access_group_id) self.post(endpoint=remove_initiator_from_vag_endpoint, data=[initiator.get('initiatorId')], json_return=False) def use_hcd_cinder_initiator(self, connector): all_initiators = self.get_initiator_info() hcd_initiator_name = 'cinder-initiator-{}'.format(connector['host']) if all_initiators: for initiator in all_initiators: if initiator.get('initiatorName') == hcd_initiator_name: return initiator return self.create_initiator(connector['initiator'], hcd_initiator_name) else: return self.create_initiator(connector['initiator'], hcd_initiator_name) def create_initiator(self, iqn, name): data = { "iqn": iqn, "initiatorName": name } json_response = self.post(endpoint=self.initiators_endpoint, data=data) return json_response def get_initiator_info(self): get_all_initiators_endpoint = self.initiators_endpoint response = self.get(endpoint=get_all_initiators_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] def get_volume_info(self, volume_id=None): if not volume_id: get_all_volumes_on_cluster_endpoint = self.volumes_endpoint + '/{}'.format(self.cluster_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_all_volumes_on_cluster_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] else: get_volume_by_id_endpoint = self.volumes_endpoint + '/{}/{}'.format(self.cluster_id, volume_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_volume_by_id_endpoint) return response.json() def get_volume_id_by_name(self, volume_name): all_volumes = self.get_volume_info() if all_volumes: for volume in all_volumes: if volume.get('volumeName') == volume_name: return volume.get('volumeId') LOG.error('Failed to get Volume ID for volume: {}'.format(volume_name)) def get_snapshot_info(self, volume_id=None): if not volume_id: get_all_snapshots_on_cluster_endpoint = self.snapshots_endpoint + '/{}'.format(self.cluster_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_all_snapshots_on_cluster_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] else: get_all_snapshots_on_volume_endpoint = self.snapshots_endpoint \ + '/{}?volumeId={}'.format(self.cluster_id, volume_id) response = self.get(endpoint=get_all_snapshots_on_volume_endpoint) return response.json().values()[0] def get_snapshot_id_by_name(self, snapshot_name): all_snapshots = self.get_snapshot_info() if all_snapshots: for snapshot in all_snapshots: if snapshot.get('snapshotName') == snapshot_name: return snapshot.get('snapshotId') LOG.error('Failed to get Snapshot ID for snapshot: {}'.format(snapshot_name)) def get_volume_id_by_snapshot_name(self, snapshot_name): all_snapshots = self.get_snapshot_info() if all_snapshots: for snapshot in all_snapshots: if snapshot.get('snapshotName') == snapshot_name: return snapshot.get('volumeId') LOG.error('Failed to get Volume ID for snapshot: {}'.format(snapshot_name)) def hcd_create_volume(self, volume): data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "volumeName": volume.get('display_name', ''), "volumeSize": int(volume.size * units.Gi), "blockSize": 4096 } json_response = self.post(endpoint=self.volumes_endpoint, data=data) return json_response def hcd_extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): volume_size = int(new_size) * units.Gi data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "volumeName": volume.get('display_name', ''), "volumeSize": volume_size } extend_volume_endpoint = self.volumes_endpoint + '/extend' json_response = self.post(endpoint=extend_volume_endpoint, data=data) return json_response def hcd_delete_volume(self, volume): # Since delete volume is also called during OnFailureRescheduleTask from openstack, # we need to be sure which process is calling backend delete volume and # allow the delete to go through only when a host is associated with the volume. # If a volume does not have a host associated with it, then most likely volume is not created at the backend # So no need to send volume delete to HCD if volume.get('host'): volume_id = self.get_volume_id_by_name(volume.get('display_name', '')) delete_volume_endpoint = self.volumes_endpoint + '/{}/{}'.format(self.cluster_id, volume_id) self.delete(endpoint=delete_volume_endpoint) def hcd_create_snapshot(self, snapshot): volume_name = snapshot['volume']['display_name'] snapshot_name = snapshot['display_name'] volume_id = self.get_volume_id_by_name(volume_name) data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "volumeId": volume_id, "snapshotName": snapshot_name } json_response = self.post(endpoint=self.snapshots_endpoint, data=data) return json_response def hcd_delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): snapshot_id = self.get_snapshot_id_by_name(snapshot['display_name']) delete_snapshot_endpoint = self.snapshots_endpoint + '/{}/{}'.format(self.cluster_id, snapshot_id) self.delete(endpoint=delete_snapshot_endpoint) def hcd_clone_volume(self, volume, snapshot): snapshot_name = snapshot['display_name'] parent_volume_id = self.get_volume_id_by_snapshot_name(snapshot_name) parent_snapshot_id = self.get_snapshot_id_by_name(snapshot_name) clone_volume_name = volume['display_name'] data = { "clusterId": self.cluster_id, "volumeId": parent_volume_id, "parentSnapshotId": parent_snapshot_id, "volumeName": clone_volume_name } clone_volume_endpoint = self.volumes_endpoint + '/clone' json_response = self.post(endpoint=clone_volume_endpoint, data=data) return json_response @_connection_checker def post(self, endpoint, data, json_return=True): response = requests.post(endpoint, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers, json=data ) if response.status_code not in [200, 201, 202, 204]: msg = _("Failed to execute api: {}, message: {}, response code: {}" .format(endpoint, response.json()['message'], response.status_code)) raise HoneycombDataAPIException(msg) if not json_return: return return response.json() @_connection_checker def put(self, endpoint, data): response = requests.put(endpoint, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers, json=data ) if response.status_code not in [200, 201, 202, 204]: msg = _("Failed to execute api: {}, message: {}, response code: {}" .format(endpoint, response.json()['message'], response.status_code)) raise HoneycombDataAPIException(msg) @_connection_checker def get(self, endpoint): return requests.get(endpoint, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers ) @_connection_checker def delete(self, endpoint): response = requests.delete(endpoint, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers ) if response.status_code not in [200, 201, 202, 204]: msg = _("Failed to execute api: {}, message: {}, response code: {}" .format(endpoint, response.json()['message'], response.status_code)) raise HoneycombDataAPIException(msg)

commit_message:
Updated pip constraints for release candidates of OpenStackSDK's first major release

A release candidate for the first major release of OpenStackSDK 1.x.x
has been published with version number 0.99.0. Release candidates will
be numbered using 0.99.x versions.

Ref.: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2022-05-19.log.html

Change-Id: I51a5b803f6646d3b1c5e198072cb3da19925fc3f
(cherry picked from commit c7ae7a5f983277ae0ccf340e113d37bc52da5d74)

commit_message:
overcloud delete - bm_deploy - delete ports

The `overcloud node unprovision` command will delete
ports by default. See: tripleoclient/v2/overcloud_node.py#L422

Let's do the same by default when using `overcloud delete` with
the `--baremtal-deployment` option.

Change-Id: I881fa2cbb6612e10dbe85a800f38c6922fc0a92b

Add mount_type in storage::disk

This makes it possible to select uuid instead of path.

commit_message:
Provide opportunity to override TESTING_BRANCH

Since OSA has trailing releases, we might want to override branch we're
testing. At the moment it's set based on the .gitreview file.

At same time we temporary override branch to yoga, as deploying from
master breaks installation.

Change-Id: Iacef9bec9ab8f2f15a56e3d95f71734277d7a8c7

supported by strongswan.

commit_message:
Puppet OpenStack: Change release model to cycle-with-rc

In the past, Puppet OpenStack project created a release per milestone.
However this is not really beneficial because modules should be used
with the actual release of services, while it causes additional
maintenance costs.

We discussed this in ml[1], and agreed to move to cycle-with-rc release
model so that we create only a single release per cycle.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-January/026872.html

Change-Id: Idb7a953c4dcd18bf59f2ae7b100acfaf6332eaf7

commit_message:
Define new functional test tox env for placement gate to run

We have placement-nova-tox-functional-py38 job defined and run
on placement gate[1] to run the nova functional test excluding
api and notification _sample_tests, and db-related tests but that
job skip those tests via tox_extra_args which is not right way
to do as we currently facing error when tox_extra_args is included
in tox siblings task
- https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/commit/c02c28a982da8d5a9e7b4ca38d30967f6cd1531d

- https://zuul.openstack.org/build/a8c186b2c7124856ae32477f10e2b9a4

Let's define a new tox env which can exclude the required test
in stestr command itself.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/commit/bd5b19c00e1ab293fc157f4699bc4f4719731c25/.zuul.yaml#L83

Change-Id: I20d6339a5203aed058f432f68e2ec1af57030401
(cherry picked from commit 7b063e4d0518af3e57872bc0288a94edcd33c19d)
(cherry picked from commit 64f5c1cfb0e7223603c06e22a204716919d05294)

commit_message:
db: Migrate "snapshot" APIs to enginefacade

Migrate snapshot-related APIs from the legacy enginefacade to the modern
context-based enginefacade.

Change-Id: Ica5004a734fc7d3becec9a786485e83aabad79f6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-23 03:32:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/bf5d54b843d316403fb9fda4f7977272d4c93018', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary usage of pick

The pick function requires at least one non empty value and fails if
it takes only undefined values with the following error.

Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, pick(): must receive at

Change-Id: I8c77bcfae63a420039d28100cad98706e9a8a0c2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-03-23 06:27:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/1bbb18c04ded81cf3a4154823ae30e01421ad383', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary usage of pick

'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary usage of pick

This change removes usage of pick to determine vnx_pool_names.

The only benefit of the current usage is that puppet fails when both
storage_vnx_pool_names and storage_vnx_pool_names are undefined.
However this is caught by the subsequent resource definition, which
emits more clear error telling the required parameter is not set.

Change-Id: I8c77bcfae63a420039d28100cad98706e9a8a0c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/11/834811/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
db: Migrate "volume metadata" APIs to enginefacade

Migrate volume metadata-related APIs from the legacy enginefacade to the
modern context-based enginefacade.

Change-Id: I9ba5e935ff455da673312cd88cfc778e4cf6160b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/96/830096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, model): return model_query(context, model, read_deleted="no").filter_by( volume_id=volume_id ) def _volume_x_metadata_get(context, volume_id, model): rows = _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, model).all()def _volume_x_metadata_get_item(context, volume_id, key, model, notfound_exec): result = ( _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, model) .filter_by(key=key) .first() )# TODO: We dropped 'subtransactions=True' here. Is that an issue? def _volume_x_metadata_update( context, volume_id, metadata, delete, model, add=True, update=True ): # Set existing metadata to deleted if delete argument is True. This is # committed immediately to the DB if delete: expected_values = {'volume_id': volume_id} # We don't want to delete keys we are going to update if metadata: expected_values['key'] = db.Not(metadata.keys()) conditional_update( context, model, {'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow()}, expected_values, ) # Get existing metadata db_meta = _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, model).all() save = [] skip = [] # We only want to send changed metadata. for row in db_meta: if row.key in metadata: value = metadata.pop(row.key) if row.value != value and update: # ORM objects will not be saved until we do the bulk save row.value = value save.append(row) continue skip.append(row) # We also want to save non-existent metadata if add: save.extend( model(key=key, value=value, volume_id=volume_id) for key, value in metadata.items() ) # Do a bulk save if save: context.session.bulk_save_objects(save, update_changed_only=True) # Construct result dictionary with current metadata save.extend(skip) result = {row['key']: row['value'] for row in save}def _volume_user_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id): return _volume_x_metadata_get_query( context, volume_id, models.VolumeMetadata ) def _volume_image_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id): return _volume_x_metadata_get_query( context, volume_id, models.VolumeGlanceMetadata )def _volume_user_metadata_get(context, volume_id): return _volume_x_metadata_get(context, volume_id, models.VolumeMetadata)def _volume_user_metadata_get_item(context, volume_id, key): return _volume_x_metadata_get_item( context, volume_id, key, models.VolumeMetadata, exception.VolumeMetadataNotFound, )def _volume_user_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete): return _volume_x_metadata_update( context, volume_id, metadata, delete, models.VolumeMetadata )def _volume_image_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete): return _volume_x_metadata_update( context, volume_id, metadata, delete, models.VolumeGlanceMetadata ) metadata = { meta_entry.key: meta_entry.id for meta_entry in db_data if meta_entry.key == key }@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.writer query = _volume_user_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id).filter_by( key=key ) query.update( { 'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow(), 'updated_at': entity.updated_at, } ) elif meta_type == common.METADATA_TYPES.image: metadata_id = _volume_glance_metadata_key_to_id( context, volume_id, key ) query = _volume_image_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id).filter_by( id=metadata_id ) query.update( { 'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow(), 'updated_at': entity.updated_at, } ) else: raise exception.InvalidMetadataType( metadata_type=meta_type, id=volume_id )@main_context_manager.writer return _volume_user_metadata_update( context, volume_id, metadata, delete ) elif meta_type == common.METADATA_TYPES.image: return _volume_image_metadata_update( context, volume_id, metadata, delete ) else: raise exception.InvalidMetadataType( metadata_type=meta_type, id=volume_id )def _volume_admin_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id): return _volume_x_metadata_get_query( context, volume_id, models.VolumeAdminMetadata )def _volume_admin_metadata_get(context, volume_id): return volume_id, models.VolumeMetadata, session=session) def _volume_image_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, models.VolumeGlanceMetadata, session=session)def _volume_user_metadata_get(context, volume_id, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_get(context, volume_id, models.VolumeMetadata, session=session)def _volume_user_metadata_get_item(context, volume_id, key, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_get_item(context, volume_id, key, models.VolumeMetadata, exception.VolumeMetadataNotFound, session=session)def _volume_user_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete, models.VolumeMetadata, session=session)def _volume_image_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete, models.VolumeGlanceMetadata, session=session) metadata = {meta_entry.key: meta_entry.id for meta_entry in db_data if meta_entry.key == key} query = _volume_user_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id).\ filter_by(key=key) query.update({'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow(), 'updated_at': entity.updated_at}) elif meta_type == common.METADATA_TYPES.image: metadata_id = _volume_glance_metadata_key_to_id(context, volume_id, key) query = _volume_image_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id).\ filter_by(id=metadata_id) query.update({'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow(), 'updated_at': entity.updated_at}) else: raise exception.InvalidMetadataType(metadata_type=meta_type, id=volume_id) return _volume_user_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete) elif meta_type == common.METADATA_TYPES.image: return _volume_image_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete) else: raise exception.InvalidMetadataType(metadata_type=meta_type, id=volume_id)def _volume_admin_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, session=None): return _volume_x_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id, models.VolumeAdminMetadata, session=session)def update=update)def volume_admin_metadata_delete(context, volume_id, key): query = _volume_admin_metadata_get_query(context, volume_id).\ filter_by(key=key) query.update({'deleted': True, 'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow(), 'updated_at': entity.updated_at})def volume_admin_metadata_update(context, volume_id, metadata, delete, add=True, update=True): return _volume_admin_metadata_update(context, commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for nodejs jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-nodejs-jobs'
for nodejs jobs. This patch updates ``.zuul.yaml`` to
use that template to run nodejs jobs here.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/831929
Change-Id: I9a4656e78314bf56130a14152c7791f577bb4f11

commit_message:
Unpin iPhyton in python3

iPython was pinned because of its recent incompatibility with Python 3
but now that pin breaks tests in Python3, since recent nbclient
requires iPython>=7.0 .
This patch makes sure that iPython is unpinned in Python 3 to avoid
that requirement issue.

Change-Id: I1178252b3ea7a4f76f6435e52cda6da85f778f36

commit_message:
Do not load options for v2password plugin

This change is a very partial revert of [1] which made some keystone
plguins loaded to include auth options.
Keystone v2 API was removed long ago, and it's not expected that any
user is still using auth plugin for that removed API.

[1] 89fd50d0f90fa83c615b235476f60249a1bca0c2
Change-Id: I740eb6772aa67b62488d7387b6c3a9c021dc9351

commit_message:
Clean up unused heat_admin_* parameters

These parameters were used when we used puppet to manage keystone
resources like domains, but now keystone resources are managed by
ansible.

Change-Id: Ie1ae40a714852a3e4088556b9a87f24a31f092e6

commit_message:
Heat: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function was deprecated in favor of the lookup function.
This replacement is required to use upgrade deprecated hiera 3 to
the latest hiera 5[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_migrate.html

Change-Id: I8a51af2e082410d4069342fc79e1fe72c58eaede
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/36/831636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not relabel /etc/yum.repos.d nor /etc/pki/rpm-gpg

Relabelling is locked anyway, and we don't want a container to write
anything in there anyway.
Ensure it's read-only to prevent any bad attempt.

Change-Id: I74e29c4254cf32379b578f8368b53aa503a6aeb2

subject: Added log volumes for ceilometer-agent-ipmi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-22 07:23:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ceilometer/ceilometer-agent-ipmi-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/6914b48527fcef68cc6bbeead493e20541dd681f', 'message': 'Added log volumes for ceilometer-agent-ipmi

Added log volumes for ceilometer-agent-ipmi as it turns out all
polling from ceilometer-agent-ipmi are written inside the container
namespace and never goes down to /var/log/containers/ceilometer
which makes this container size increase over time as well as
avoiding any kind of log rotation.

Change-Id: Ib5c5e64fb8adf046ec105cd054dc2567b8616f8b
Closes-bug: #1964518
(cherry picked from commit 5d1e6f8c0ff5b0927bdada37ff474dedd6ebac69)
(cherry picked from commit 9049edcd7b0fa07ba4f251d75b78ce1c19d501c1)
'}]
commit_message:
Added log volumes for ceilometer-agent-ipmi

Added log volumes for ceilometer-agent-ipmi as it turns out all
polling from ceilometer-agent-ipmi are written inside the container
namespace and never goes down to /var/log/containers/ceilometer
which makes this container size increase over time as well as
avoiding any kind of log rotation.

Change-Id: Ib5c5e64fb8adf046ec105cd054dc2567b8616f8b
Closes-bug: #1964518
(cherry picked from commit 5d1e6f8c0ff5b0927bdada37ff474dedd6ebac69)
(cherry picked from commit 9049edcd7b0fa07ba4f251d75b78ce1c19d501c1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/834594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
db: Remove unnecessary session management

oslo.db will automatically rollback a session when used within a
transaction context manager. There's no need for us to do this handling
manually.

Change-Id: Iff0fb06c63b0237b29e86f5226bb93080dfe93d9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/83/841083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if project_id is None: project_id = context.project_id # Loop until we can lock all the resource rows we'll be modifying while True: # Get the current usages and lock existing rows usages = _get_quota_usages( context, project_id, resources=deltas.keys() ) missing = [res for res in deltas if res not in usages] # If we have successfully locked all the rows we can continue. # SELECT ... FOR UPDATE used in _get_quota usages cannot lock # non-existing rows, so there can be races with other requests # trying to create those rows. if not missing: break # Create missing rows calculating current values instead of # assuming there are no used resources as admins may have been # using this mechanism to force quota usage refresh. for resource in missing: updates = _get_sync_updates( elevated, project_id, resources, resource, _quota_usage_create( elevated, project_id, resource, updates[resource], 0, until_refresh or None, ) # NOTE: When doing the commit there can be a race condition with # other service instances or thread that are also creating the # same rows and in that case this will raise either a Deadlock # exception (when multiple transactions were creating the same rows # and the DB failed to acquire the row lock on the non-first # transaction) or a DBDuplicateEntry exception if some other # transaction created the row between us doing the # _get_quota_usages and here. In both cases this transaction will # be rolled back and the wrap_db_retry decorator will retry. # Commit new rows to the DB. context.session.commit() # Start a new session before trying to lock all the rows again. By # trying to get all the locks in a loop we can protect us against # admins directly deleting DB rows. context.session.begin() # Handle usage refresh for resource in deltas.keys(): # Do we need to refresh the usage? refresh = False if usages[resource].in_use < 0: # If we created the entry right now we want to refresh. # Negative in_use count indicates a desync, so try to # heal from that... refresh = True elif usages[resource].until_refresh is not None: usages[resource].until_refresh -= 1 if usages[resource].until_refresh <= 0: elif ( max_age and usages[resource].updated_at is not None and ( ( timeutils.utcnow() - usages[resource].updated_at ).total_seconds() >= max_age ) ): refresh = True # OK, refresh the usage if refresh: updates = _get_sync_updates( elevated, project_id, resources, resource, ) # Updates will always contain a single resource usage matching # the resource variable. usages[resource].in_use = updates[resource] usages[resource].until_refresh = until_refresh or None # There are 3 cases where we want to update "until_refresh" in the # DB: when we enabled it, when we disabled it, and when we changed # to a value lower than the current remaining value. else: res_until = usages[resource].until_refresh if (res_until is None and until_refresh) or ( (res_until or 0) > (until_refresh or 0) ): # Check for deltas that would go negative unders = [ r for r, delta in deltas.items() if delta < 0 and delta + usages[r].in_use < 0 ] # TODO(mc_nair): Should ignore/zero alloc if using non-nested driver # Now, let's check the quotas # NOTE(Vek): We're only concerned about positive increments. # If a project has gone over quota, we want them to # be able to reduce their usage without any # problems. overs = [ r for r, delta in deltas.items() if quotas[r] >= 0 and delta >= 0 and quotas[r] < delta + usages[r].total ] # NOTE(Vek): The quota check needs to be in the transaction, # but the transaction doesn't fail just because # we're over quota, so the OverQuota raise is # outside the transaction. If we did the raise # here, our usage updates would be discarded, but # they're not invalidated by being over-quota. # Create the reservations if not overs: reservations = [] for resource, delta in deltas.items(): usage = usages[resource] reservation = _reservation_create( elevated, str(uuid.uuid4()), usage, project_id, resource, delta, expire, reservations.append(reservation.uuid) # Also update the reserved quantity # NOTE(Vek): Again, we are only concerned here about # positive increments. Here, though, we're # worried about the following scenario: # # 1) User initiates resize down. # 2) User allocates a new instance. # 3) Resize down fails or is reverted. # 4) User is now over quota. # # To prevent this, we only update the # reserved value if the delta is positive. if delta > 0: usages[resource].reserved += delta if unders: LOG.warning( "Reservation would make usage less than 0 for the " "following resources, so on commit they will be " "limited to prevent going below 0: %s", unders, ) if overs: usages = { k: dict(in_use=v.in_use, reserved=v.reserved) for k, v in usages.items() } raise exception.OverQuota( overs=sorted(overs), quotas=quotas, usages=usages )

If we did the raise # here, our usage updates would be discarded, but # they're not invalidated by being over-quota. # Create the reservations if not overs: reservations = [] for resource, delta in deltas.items(): usage = usages[resource] reservation = _reservation_create( elevated, str(uuid.uuid4()), usage, project_id, resource, delta, expire, ) reservations.append(reservation.uuid) # Also update the reserved quantity # NOTE(Vek): Again, we are only concerned here about # positive increments. commit_message:
Drop openEuler support

The job is broken since it is running with python3.7 and most services
now require at least python3.8.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Ie21f71acffabd78c79e2b141951ccf30a5c06445

Fix ironic-lib from source and branch detection in IPA builds

Prevents the ironic-lib CI from testing ironic-lib changes in IPA.

Change-Id: I936f6c1506c585826501ff3ac0bad0c755b4d360

commit_message:
Ensure ha_confs path is created when keepalived manager is initialised

With dependent change we have reverted commit
c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587 which included a minor addition
to neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py to ensure ha_confs path is created when
the keepalived manager is initialised.

With this change we are bringing this feature back as it still may be
useful.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/834162
Change-Id: I1b445b59d61b2fc1cacc5797bd86597e963d64af

commit_message:
Switch to c9-stream image in standalone libvirt env

Master no longer runs with c8-stream, this
env file is used in oooq centos ci gate job,
so switch to 9-stream image.

Also use image from cloud.centos.org as image
at images.rdoproject.org is quite old and have
issues. Add md5sum in image as md5sum for centos9
images shipped at different location.

Also update container image for c9-stream.

Change-Id: I34b8872f68025118d1d1ca727c78ec312e57ea61

  swift::storage::policy { '1':
      policy_name    => '3-Replica-Policy',
      policy_aliases => 'green',
This fixes the accepted pattenr to allow single-value for policy_aliases
parameter.

Also, the whole expression is updated to more strictly validate
the pattern, especially when more than 2 aliases are given.

Change-Id: I62c86097c717d2a74c100386cf20e07976571805
"}]
commit_message:
Allow single alias in swift_storage_policy provider

Regex validation for aliases in swift_storage_policy provider does not
allow single alias value, like for exemple:
  swift::storage::policy { '1':
      policy_name    => '3-Replica-Policy',
      policy_aliases => 'green',
This fixes the accepted pattenr to allow single-value for policy_aliases
parameter.

Also, the whole expression is updated to more strictly validate
the pattern, especially when more than 2 aliases are given.

Change-Id: I62c86097c717d2a74c100386cf20e07976571805

commit_message:
Increase MANILA_SERVICE_VM_FLAVOR_DISK

To build the manila service image with
Ubuntu Jammy Jellyfish (22.04 LTS) we need
a slight bump in the storage allocated.

Change-Id: I1d60834c2045c069de25a1c8979c433d4dd50684
Related-bug: #1870412
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix local sources of git repositories

This is I2cbf1f539880d512aa223c3ef3a4b19ee18854ac extended to fix
the case when a git repository is used with a git repo.
This is probably a rarer use case but, still, we use it in CI
for in-review changes testing.

Change-Id: I77b0dcd2e9dfd8ea8390a471b80c8954b67ef91b
(cherry picked from commit b888f68daf6cb3ed9782fe85045858b6a04d4911)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/95/842395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mgoddard): Change ownership of files to root:root. This # avoids an issue introduced by the fix for git CVE-2022-24765, # which breaks PBR when the source checkout is not owned by the # user installing it. LP#1969096 def reset_userinfo(tarinfo): tarinfo.uid = tarinfo.gid = 0 tarinfo.uname = tarinfo.gname = "root" return tarinfo arcname=os.path.basename(source['source']), filter=reset_userinfo)

commit_message:
masakari: support libvirt SASL in instance monitor

Since enabling libvirt SASL authentication, the masakari instance
monitor fails to connect to libvirt. We see the following error in logs:

    libvirt.libvirtError: authentication failed: Failed to start SASL
    negotiation: -4 (SASL(-4): no mechanism available: No worthy mechs
    found)

This change adds support for SASL authentication in Masakari instance
monitor.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/834456
Closes-Bug: #1965754
Change-Id: I974046662b383a12ac6281b725523760a96657bd
(cherry picked from commit 5d28a7c89bbac4a15f7d8f7a64c3767ea988efbd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/42/842742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #################### # libvirt #################### # Whether to enable libvirt SASL authentication. libvirt_enable_sasl: true # Username for libvirt SASL. libvirt_sasl_authname: "nova" # List of enabled libvirt SASL authentication mechanisms. libvirt_sasl_mech_list: - "{{ 'SCRAM-SHA-256' if libvirt_tls | bool else 'DIGEST-MD5' }}"

commit_message:
Fix ineffective max_header_line

The [service:api] max_header_line parameter has had no effect since
Train and it was effectively replaced by the [DEFAULT] max_header_line
parameter provided by oslo.service.

This updates the parameter definition accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1967825
Change-Id: Ia969cc31b380950a87c0be0b911cc214b4219d82

commit_message:
Remove keystone_v2 parameter

... because it was officially deprecated during Yoga release[1].

Identity v2 API was removed several cycles ago and the parameter has
been of no use since then.

[1] ba29e31a7a4ac734a165f9348c1256b6309d99b9

Change-Id: I7d0f9c441f5d90a4387cd987e7ea064eb7cf4d7e

heartbeat_interval parameter.

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I7dc431aea5d800f000826cb371c4f1e1c89dc302

Use Horizon project template for nodejs jobs

commit_message:
Replace deprecated ugettext_lazy and ungettext_lazy

The ugettext_lazy method and the ungettext_lazy method are both
deprecated since Django 3.0[1].

These were already replaced in Horizon repo by [2].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.0/releases/3.0/#id3
[2] cd7c1b5110fe1f64cd9dfbeb1072b37912d0efee

Change-Id: Iee48af32956787cb4e16601fea34570f63df511c

commit_message:
Fix malformed OIDCMemCacheServers

Change from comma separated list of memcache servers to space separated list.
Comma seperated list results in a 500 error response.
Upstream docs state this should be space separated and can be found here:
https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf#L629-L631

Closes-Bug: #1972033
Change-Id: Ibaef3672c656213dd5ba1488379d686130e041c5
(cherry picked from commit 6563191de81457ec04eaa44e3d9a639c4dacbe76)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/40/842940/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-23 10:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/iscsid.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/27930ca540a10c3075fd3ce1bb6008cff4e99c8b', 'message': 'iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I9d6befd2ec441cb8511f3d37980f7014ee4ad2ce
'}]
commit_message:
iscsid: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I9d6befd2ec441cb8511f3d37980f7014ee4ad2ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/58/842958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Updated pip constraints for release candidates of OpenStackSDK's first major release

A release candidate for the first major release of OpenStackSDK 1.x.x
has been published with version number 0.99.0. Release candidates will
be numbered using 0.99.x versions.

Ref.: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2022-05-19.log.html

Change-Id: I51a5b803f6646d3b1c5e198072cb3da19925fc3f

commit_message:
Install updated CA certs for CentOS 7

During a process of building BMC image, CentOS 7 gets certificate
error.
It needs to be updated, before the process continues.

Conflicts:
  bin/install_openstackbmc.sh

Change-Id: Id90883fbcc9410040fa7c7889b555ccc8da6db1c
(cherry picked from commit 6caa316959da8ca28a44c3b90c5bb86adc1aab35)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-25 13:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/install.d/20-iptables'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/72b84c022ec1b14206bf86d9b8ab9587f3db0555', 'message': 'Use goto, chain policy and drop REJECT

The current way iptables chains are managed prevent any change in
tripleo itself, such as [1].

In order to allow a more evolutive management, it's better to actually
rely on the chain policy and use of the "goto" option.

This change introduces:
- "-g" instead of "-j"
- removal of the final REJECT rule in openstack-INPUT chain
- DROP policy for INPUT chain

First one will ensure the packet will go back to INPUT in case it
doesn't match anything in the openstack-INPUT chain
Second one will ensure rules being added after that goto will be taken
into account
Third one will mimic the current way of locking the INPUT.

Note this patch is the same as proposed in the system-config here:
https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/839210

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839163

Change-Id: If5cd2f5d082b5c9bdf40276ed94f5b5efc4c1444
Closes-Bug: #1970211
'}]
commit_message:
Use goto, chain policy and drop REJECT

The current way iptables chains are managed prevent any change in
tripleo itself, such as [1].

In order to allow a more evolutive management, it's better to actually
rely on the chain policy and use of the "goto" option.

This change introduces:
- "-g" instead of "-j"
- removal of the final REJECT rule in openstack-INPUT chain
- DROP policy for INPUT chain

First one will ensure the packet will go back to INPUT in case it
doesn't match anything in the openstack-INPUT chain
Second one will ensure rules being added after that goto will be taken
into account
Third one will mimic the current way of locking the INPUT.

Note this patch is the same as proposed in the system-config here:
https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/839210

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839163

Change-Id: If5cd2f5d082b5c9bdf40276ed94f5b5efc4c1444
Closes-Bug: #1970211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/12/839212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :INPUT DROP [0:0]-A INPUT -g openstack-INPUT:INPUT DROP [0:0]-A INPUT -g openstack-INPUT
deleted_lines: :INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]-A INPUT -j openstack-INPUT-A openstack-INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited:INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]-A INPUT -j openstack-INPUT-A openstack-INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp6-adm-prohibited

commit_message:
Bump minimum version of gnocchiclient for aggregats API support

The commit 74eadfbd58359b7ebe9e1e40ae6b6ff245146bb8 introduced usage
of aggregates API, which is available since gnocchiclient 6.0.0 .

This change bumps the minimum version to ensure the API is available.

Change-Id: I64a984fe64c8fe69856980df9e28a67f5eb29b58
(cherry picked from commit 6648f6b684a09efd5598e5a709223992bdebfa12)

commit_message:
Suppress Warnings for SQL Alchemy IN operator

The `in_` operator of SQL Alchemy emits a warning when it coerces a
Subquery object into a select() implicitly [1].

This patch suppresses the warnings by explicitly coercing a Subquery
object to select() as shown in [2].

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/3d99ee28ed368c3bdbeaf872ef65b0c9a7c0da33
[2] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/blob/605d0d905855684bfe4409532af98f336ae38f82/test/sql/test_operators.py#L3295-L3319

Closes-Bug: #1967700
Change-Id: I90729463613e8d4768e0e466b9636967ccfa48e7

commit_message:
SAIO: add backend ratelimit middleware and config file

This patch added the backend_ratelimit middleware and the
backend-ratelimit.conf to the SAIO configuration.
We use a different backend-ratelimit config for each "node".

Change-Id: I0582122ae7c50722c2ae8250148a334315560b44

this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I97ed4117e009f75c4670aa78b0d50db59dcb7da8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-dashboard refs/changes/89/789989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set False to include_empty_option

In _populate_custom_choices(), all methods called at the method have
True as a second argument. It means that the default values sepcified
in a stack are not shown as default when launch stack form.
The fileds always show 'Select Flavor/Image/Network'.
Users doesn't expect to choose default value by hand.
This change shows the default values defined at a template.

Also, image_field_data() doesn't use parameter, include_empty_option.
This change modfies the method to change the behavior based on the
parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1619465
Change-Id: I4b6bef322a668a805abcd4bc472d30f6d1df3a0a

commit_message:
Replace deprecated django.conf.urls.url()

This method is deprecated in Django 3.1[1], in favor of
django.urls.re_path(), and triggers the following warning.

RemovedInDjango40Warning: django.conf.urls.url() is deprecated in favor
of django.urls.re_path().

This was already fixed in Horizon by [2].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/releases/3.1/#id2
[2] d9266fd82c1f0acc6b7236a6dc9b7e510985eb13

Change-Id: Ib921e98f220efb697e42673ca43da36cc151e7c7

replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

commit_message:
Create Ceph pools/cephx keys with cli-deployed-ceph.yaml

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools and tripleo_cephadm_keys
parameters are defined, then call the tripleo_cephadm
role's pools, keys, and export tasks.

If the tripleo_cephadm_pools were created, then ensure
it's values are exported under CephPools in the deployed
Ceph file. Do the same for tripleo_ceph_client_vars,
ceph_client_key, and ceph_client_username. These last
two values are only used by TripleO Heat Templates so
they have no defaults in the the tripleo_cephadm role.
They're only optionally passed through as --extra-vars
by python-tripleoclient.

Also, handle when tripleo_enabled_services is undefined
and ensure tripleo_ceph_client_vars path exists before
creating the file.

Conflicts:
tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-deployed-ceph.yaml
roles/tripleo_cephadm/templates/deployed_ceph.yaml.j2

Includes Ic52ee6091ebab6f937a4a15c83a28f0b3918d374
so that this backport does not introduce a bug.

Change-Id: Ib87a8a5a550676b32302c0cc9c447f8b9fe3a149
(cherry picked from commit 210447990474940923e1be58e726ccf5bb0b27b3)

commit_message:
Start using security-groups-shared-filtering from neutron-lib

Remove security_groups_shared_filtering_lib extension and
use security-groups-shared-filtering from neutron-lib as
it is available since version 2.17.0 [0].

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/812617

Change-Id: Ife9b1ae47f5b447898bce0d8b44500f91f6dfbfb
Related-Bug: #1942615

subject: Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-23 15:33:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/26535b4912aeeb4c1301f86fdb74e689803a5fc6', 'message': 'Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint

This partially reverts 6af63e1bb13e79d8e7a0f9c12986b24b3e64ff68 and
removes the healthcheck options added to the zaqar websocket endpoint.
The endpoint does not support the OPTIONS verb used by the httpchk.

Because websocket service behaves differently from usual REST servers,
this also removes httplog.

This fix is directly submitted to stable/train because the options
parameter were updated only in stable/train. (Because Zaqar was removed
in stable/wallaby and we "missed" updating the endpoint in
stale/victoria fortunately)

Closes-Bug: #1975462
Change-Id: I48330f0a6b79f25dcc25c59d33c90fa62407c635
'}]
commit_message:
Trainl-only: Fix broken healthcheck of zaqar websocket endpoint

This partially reverts 6af63e1bb13e79d8e7a0f9c12986b24b3e64ff68 and
removes the healthcheck options added to the zaqar websocket endpoint.
The endpoint does not support the OPTIONS verb used by the httpchk.

Because websocket service behaves differently from usual REST servers,
this also removes httplog.

This fix is directly submitted to stable/train because the options
parameter were updated only in stable/train. (Because Zaqar was removed
in stable/wallaby and we "missed" updating the endpoint in
stale/victoria fortunately)

Closes-Bug: #1975462
Change-Id: I48330f0a6b79f25dcc25c59d33c90fa62407c635
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/89/842989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
neutron: Avoid hard-coding defaults

This change replaces redundant defaults in nova::neutron, which define
the exact same values as service defaults, by $::os_service_default, to
reduce effort to maintain the implementations to keep them consistent
with any update in nova itself.

Change-Id: Ia01c936611a846399f19b1b0425e5ab4ff18a9e1

commit_message:
Spec for refactor API structure

Change-Id: Ie513e12ff6c9dbfb7fcc4f74f1610cdd3178605a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-specs refs/changes/77/841077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Refactor API Structure Proposal =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/refactor-api-structure This spec proposes to refactor the Cyborg API structure. Problem description =================== Nowadays, Cyborg api is deployed by pecan structure, which is complicated to process the return result content, and doesn't support to process the exception message, we can't define the API return status code and message like nova, cinder, etc. In additional, the Cyborg api doesn't support pagination. Use Cases --------- * As a user, I would like Cyborg API return result is standard, with http status code and content. For these APIs that return an exception, I would like the return result contains exception status code and error message. Proposed changes ================ Change the current structure from pecan to paste to deploy the APIs. ``cyborg/api/wsgi_app.py`` Add faultwrap in api pipeline to process exception result. ``etc/cyborg/api-paste.ini`` Add schema check. ``cyborg/api/controllers/v2/schemas/__init__.py`` Add new policy check and define api route. ``setup.cfg`` and ``cyborg/api/urlmap.py`` Put all api process to conductor service. ``cyborg/conductor/api.py`` Unify all api return result and support pagination for resources list. ``cyborg/api/controllers/v2/devices.py`` Add new version controller. ``cyborg/api/controllers/v2/versionsV2.py`` Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The return values format will be change for these below APIs: List devices: /v2/devices before: after: Get device: /v2/devices/{device_uuid} List device profiles: /v2/device_profiles Get device profile: /v2/device_profile/{device_profile_name_or_uuid} Create device profile: /v2/device_profiles List ARQS: /v2/accelerator_requests Get ARQ: /v2/accelerator_requests/{accelerator_request_uuid} Create ARQ: /v2/accelerator_requests Update ARQ: /v2/accelerator_requests/{accelerator_request_uuid} List deployable: /v2/deployables Get deployable: /v2/deployables/{deployable_uuid} Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- When the developer to add new API, use schema to check the request parameters, add policy check and put api db interaction to conductor service. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: songwenping Work Items ---------- * Add new policy. * Add schema check. * Put api db interaction to conductor service. * Add exception process. * Update related test cases. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======== * Unit tests will be updated. Documentation Impact ==================== Update References ========== .. [1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cyborg/+/841013 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release - Description * - Zed - Introduced

commit_message:
Switch grub network boot from TFTP to HTTP

This is preferable assuming the http module is commonly included in
grub binaries.

Change-Id: I2ab07cea63948020d19d0485b6e8485e48656ac0

commit_message:
Restart rpc services once to test service cleanup

Add a step to restart all rpc services at startup
to ensure that our service clean up steps are not failing.

Change-Id: I9c7569ace63d823971ad6e3289cf4a40f09a25f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/67/842267/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Test service cleanup by restarting all rpc services restart_senlin_rpc

subject: Improve quota API validations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-17 19:40:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/3278f43588f8df82ab4e1de7c6e58a1ec94dcc5f', 'message': 'Improve quota API validations

This patch improves the quotas API validations and test coverage. Invalid quota settings will now be caught at the API/Central layer and not down in the storage layer(DB).

commit_message:
Improve quota API validations

This patch improves the quotas API validations and test coverage. Invalid quota settings will now be caught at the API/Central layer and not down in the storage layer(DB).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/842238
Closes-Bug: #1934596
Change-Id: I474bdd988a6cc3a9bcce1b65c2f49216dd85addf

commit_message:
Added lifecycle management isolation testing to openstack umbrella
chart(currently 6 subcharts) and other non-umbrella charts(which will be
merged into umbrella chart)

	Gate scripts to test the changes submitted to openstack helm charts. These scripts will upgrade each chart  and ensure that this upgrade is not effecting o        ther charts.

Change-Id: Ibc6aea15fb8a6086a99f744ae9169cedb295bf9e

commit_message:
Use full URL to call external NFVO

Common http utilities used by v2 API use keystoneauth1 module.
If a server is a service in OpenStack, clients can omit endpoint.
But if a server is a service outside of OpenStack, clients can't
omit endpoint.
This patch fixes to add endpoint to URL in case that a server is
an external NFVO.

Change-Id: I3cf8b608d2996a47f798184ae4006282f672dd02

commit_message:
Replace wait_for with wait_for_connection

The "Wait for provisioned nodes to boot" tasks in cli playbooks
should use the wait_for_connection plugin instead of the wait_for
plugin.

ansible.builtin.wait_for_connection
 : Waits until remote system is reachable/usable

Change-Id: Ib53852ed235a0965f9bf2be7c957f7fca141462d
(cherry picked from commit b4e23529891eccd83e1e313e871e299b16ed93e7
                and commit ba4e9908acd2931c693f45cda8b4a26748a3b846)

commit_message:
Disable Octavia management gateway on update

A previous commit [0] disables the gateway of the lb-mgmt-subnet when
the subnet is created, but the playbook should also disable the gateway
if the subnet already exists (on update for instance).

[0] I1d007e59f95de815bd465d8d452d8270434f8090

Change-Id: I0c2377ad14ec244069bc022a64b64c3e39b07779

commit_message:
Use centos amphora image in the FIPS jobs

The FIPS jobs use centos-8-stream controllers but the image is still
based on ubuntu, this commit updates the amphora images to
centos-8-stream and enable FIPS inside the amphora.

Change-Id: I8916796ed6727a103907a33d3c14e99e1d3734e6
(cherry picked from commit 74a7cbe122c4bb2d826cfb2b9c0e1657df9aedec)

subject: [stable-only] Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-20 21:18:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3faa6deb68df44a834a211d2efe0969e447570ad', 'message': "Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack

Devstack creates the tempest virtual env with upper
constraints set by TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS[1].
For stable/train, they are stable/train constraints but then nova
run tempest in run_tests.sh then it does not set/pass the
upper constraints so master constraints is used and it ends up
recreating the tempest virtual env and fail the job.

We should make sure that upper constraints used in nova tempest run
and devstack is same.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f50f83571d4348e996e175ea5aad97f7/log/job-output.txt#5100

commit_message:
[stable-only] Use Tempest's run upper constraints from devstack

Devstack creates the tempest virtual env with upper
constraints set by TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS[1].
For stable/train, they are stable/train constraints but then nova
run tempest in run_tests.sh then it does not set/pass the
upper constraints so master constraints is used and it ends up
recreating the tempest virtual env and fail the job.

We should make sure that upper constraints used in nova tempest run
and devstack is same.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f50f83571d4348e996e175ea5aad97f7/log/job-output.txt#5100

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/stable/train/stackrc#L320

Change-Id: Iad2d198c58512b26dc2733b97bedeffc00108656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/842813/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set upper constraint for Tempest run so that it matches # with what devstack is using and does not recreate the # tempest virtual env. TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS=$(set +o xtrace && source $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/stackrc && echo $TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS) export UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS

commit_message:
Make ``MechDriverSetupBase`` abstract

The class ``MechDriverSetupBase`` is a base class for other testing
classes. Make it explicitly an abstract class although that won't
prevent from instantiating an object of this class.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I0236f5ede20cd1cbc44a5a79013eab12a7843389

commit_message:
Add cell internalapi VIP in controllers /etc/hosts

When adding a cell into a tls-everywhere environment, also the
cellcontroller(s) internal api vip(s) is/are required to be added to
the central overcloud controllers, because when using a tls-everywhere
environment nova uses the cell controller internal api hostname instead
of the vip to connect to the cell DB.

When user executes the create-nova-cell-v2 playbook, as documented in
[0], add such extra entry/entries into the central controllers
/etc/hosts. Only do that if internal_api_vip and internal_api_hostname
are defined in the cell controller(s)' group hostvars (that would match
both non/TLS-E cases automagically).

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deploy_cellv2_basic.html#cell-create-cell

Related: rhbz#1926716

Change-Id: Ib23d06ea702545a0c2f4f47da63ce588957488fe
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c52f115d51174c450bb7503d3285ec4c6a67411c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/33/841133/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Add Cell internalapi VIP to control plan controller become: true vars: cell_domain_name: > {{ hostvars[item]['internal_api_hostname'] | regex_replace(item ~ '\.?', '') }} lineinfile: dest: "/etc/hosts" regexp: "\\s*{{ tripleo_cellv2_cell_name }}\\.?{{ cell_domain_name }}.*$" line: >- {{ hostvars[item]['internal_api_vip'] }} {{ cell_domain_name | ternary(tripleo_cellv2_cell_name ~ '.' ~ cell_domain_name, tripleo_cellv2_cell_name) }} insertafter: "# HEAT_HOSTS_END" state: present when: - hostvars[item]['internal_api_vip'] is defined - hostvars[item]['internal_api_hostname'] is defined with_items: "{{ tripleo_cellv2_cellcontroller_group }}" register: hosts_result2 tags: - hosts - create - hosts_result.changed or hosts_result2.changed

commit_message:
Add cell internalapi VIP in controllers /etc/hosts

When adding a cell into a tls-everywhere environment, also the
cellcontroller(s) internal api vip(s) is/are required to be added to
the central overcloud controllers, because when using a tls-everywhere
environment nova uses the cell controller internal api hostname instead
of the vip to connect to the cell DB.

When user executes the create-nova-cell-v2 playbook, as documented in
[0], add such extra entry/entries into the central controllers
/etc/hosts. Only do that if internal_api_vip and internal_api_hostname
are defined in the cell controller(s)' group hostvars (that would match
both non/TLS-E cases automagically).

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deploy_cellv2_basic.html#cell-create-cell

Related: rhbz#1926716

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61d4dfc60509e0b7a86251ae9e7f01a107a730c3

commit_message:
Allow amphora timezone configuration

Adds support for the ``[controller_worker] amp_timezone`` configuration
parameter. It allows to configure the timezone of the amphora.

deleted_lines: def task_core_inventory(stack_outputs, host_network=HOST_NETWORK): inv = { 'hosts': {} } task_core_data = stack_outputs.get('RoleConfig', {}).get('task_core_data', {}) deploy_data = task_core_data.get('deployment_host', {}) if deploy_data.get('hostname'): inv['hosts'][deploy_data.get('hostname')] = {'role': 'deployer'} # overcloud nodes role_net_hostname_map = stack_outputs.get( 'RoleNetHostnameMap', {}) for role_name, hostnames in role_net_hostname_map.items(): if not hostnames: continue names = hostnames.get(host_network) or [] shortnames = [n.split(".%s." % host_network)[0].lower() for n in names] for name in shortnames: if inv['hosts'].get(name): LOG.warning("task-core inventory already contains %s, " "overriding it", inv['hosts'].get(name)) inv['hosts'][name] = {'role': role_name.lower()} return inv def directord_inventory(stack_outputs, host_network=HOST_NETWORK): inv = { 'directord_server': { 'args': {}, 'targets': [] }, 'directord_clients': { 'args': {}, 'targets': [] } } task_core_data = stack_outputs.get( 'RoleConfig', {}).get('task_core_data', {}) deploy_data = task_core_data.get('deployment_host', {}) server_targets = inv['directord_server']['targets'] if deploy_data.get('hostname'): server_targets.append({'host': deploy_data.get('ip')}) client_targets = inv['directord_clients']['targets'] role_net_ip = stack_outputs.get('RoleNetIpMap', {}) for role_name in role_net_ip.keys(): # get the host network ips (default is ctlplane) ips = role_net_ip[role_name].get(host_network) or [] if not ips: continue for ip in ips: client_targets.append({'host': ip}) return inv

commit_message:
(Magnum) Add openstack coe cluster list --project

We need to be able to list clusters as admin in a project we need to support
project filtering per project.

This is the patch for the server.

Story:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2009909

Change-Id: I09f6151fcc4c431d001021cbacd7f43f24db8ca6

commit_message:
Do not use custom_member_list for glance,tacker

1. Glance and tacker

As glance and tacker are using default haproxy
configuration from haproxy-config role, there is
no need to define custom_member_list in their defaults.

This patch is proposed mainly because without it
[1] is not working for these two services.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/775627

2. Refactor variable names to avoid conflicts from user
   overwrites.

Change-Id: Ib7d6e50b7214bf0106afac1cf0aa4a60e5ab7512
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/70/842970/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
